Posts.Content: Have been depressed all day until now and I thank your post for the way I feel now.    Your story was wonderful and uplifting and hopeful.   Mary - Orlando, FL
Posts.Title: Old guard here....busy with life....10 years later....

Posts.Content: I have been in remission since July 2014.  I've had a right mastectomy - lymph nodes clear.  Yesterday, September 23, I woke up with swelling on my right hand.  No pain but uncomfortable.  I called my oncologist office and left a message.. no answer as yet.  Has anyone had the same thing and what can it mean....??
Posts.Title: I need some help - TNBC Stage 2

Posts.Content: Our tradition is roast pork, rice, salads..  This year, Mexican rice, tostadas (chicken and pork) with the fixings, crema, guacamole, etc... and tamales.
Posts.Title: Traditional New Years meals

Posts.Content: Holiday wishes to you and your family and of course to all our pink sisters.  You are all in my prayers.   Mary, ORlando, FL
Posts.Title: Sending Holiday Wishes

Posts.Content: So happy you are feeling a wee bit better (I have 3 monsters, American bulldogs, and I still walk them).  Happy Anniversary to you and your husband.  You are in my prayers always. God be with you Mary, Orlando, FL
Posts.Title: Happy Anniversary Cypress Cynthia & Danny

Posts.Content: live in Florida.  Florida does not require  employers provide employees with Insurance. Hence no insurance.  I couldn't find anywhere where I can see a doctor without insurance.  SUSAN KOMEN... no good, I really don't know what they do there but they never, not once helped me in any way shape or form.  I was unemployed at that time so I had a mamogram which I paid cash, very expensive,  2 days later, the results.  That set me back, emotionally, lots.  I couldn't function.  Luckily, my 3 wonderful, sent from heaven daughters were able to do everything.  I was in a trance and they thought I wouldn't come out of it.  MAJOR DEPRESSION!!! They sent me to the surgeon and then Onco....  While I was doing that, my daughters were looking for help... MORE WAIT... I found the lump in August and October 25th had a bilateral mastectomy (finally found a grant from the American Cancer Society which paid Osceola Regional... That was awesome).  Then more wait to see oncologist.  Waited 3 more months until I received best news ever.  I was approved for SSA and medicaid which paid for everything.  Later I found out I am fully vested in my Pension.  I could have started getting paid pension around 10 years ago.  All in all, waited a long time.. About 6 months went by from when my saint of a dog , American bulldog monster, was the reason I found the lump (he was my lifesaver, bless him) until I started chemo.  I believe that the average person waits because a, denial and b, terror.
Posts.Title: WHY DO WE WAIT** ???
